TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ReadWriteControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is ContainerControlDesigner because it uses an EditableDesignerRegion for editing the content. Designer regions allow for better control of the content being edited. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Extends design-time behavior for read/write server controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner> class is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class for equivalent control designer functionality.
This control designer provides the ability to drop controls onto the control for this designer.

block.para: Implementers of designers who would like their control to support the addition of child controls should use . If you do not want your control to support child controls, use a designer derived from .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner> class is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner> class is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void MapPropertyToStyle (string propName, object varPropValue);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void MapPropertyToStyle(string propName, object varPropValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to map.
Docs.summary: Maps a property, including description and value, to an intrinsic HTML style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner.MapPropertyToStyle%2A> method is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method for equivalent control designer functionality.
> [!NOTE] > this method must be overridden in a derived class to implement the designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnBehaviorAttached() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides notification that is raised when a behavior is attached to the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner.OnBehaviorAttached%2A> method is obsolete. Use the members of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property instead. For example, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.SetAttribute%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag.GetAttribute%2A> methods on the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.Tag%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to map properties to styles.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnComponentChanged (object sender, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnComponentChanged(object sender, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that provides data for the event.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner> class is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class for equivalent control designer functionality.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event occurs after a property has been changed. This method allows implementers to do any processing that may be needed after a property change.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void UpdateDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes the display of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
